body:
Comment 6 by **robpike**: 
I don't think this program does what you're reporting.  The pattern replaces every lower
case word, not every line, so it's doing a lot of work and, from profiling data, there's
nothing obviously wrong. You're generating tons of garbage with this algorithm and
that's where a lot of the time is going. If you split into lines, munged each line, and
stitched it back together afterwards you'd generate less garbage, but I make no
predictions about improvements in performance.

But I think there's a misapprehension in your test, too.  Cases 4 and 5 don't loop, so
of course they're much faster.

Honestly, half a second to do what you're asking it to do isn't crazy slow. This is a
very inefficient program.
